Package db.clorabase.clorem

Class Clorem

  • java.lang.Object
    • db.clorabase.clorem.Clorem
  • public class Clorem
extends java.lang.Object
    Clorem is a simple, easy to use, and fast database engine for java applications. It is a no-sql database which can save POJO's directly. You can organise your data in volumes. Each volume is like a SQL table which contains the objects as rows. You can create as many volumes as you want. You can also create as many objects as you want in each volume. The only limitation is that the objects implement the CloremObject All the methods are thread safe. You can use the database in a multi-threaded environment.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Clorem getInstance​(java.io.File databaseDir)
        This method returns the singleton instance of the Clorem database.
        Parameters:
        databaseDir - The directory where the database will be stored on the disk. This directory must be writable.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of the Clorem database

      • createVolume

        public void createVolume​(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String name)
        This method creates a new volume in the database.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the volume

      • deleteVolume

        public void deleteVolume​(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String name)
        This method deletes a volume from the database. All the objects in the volume will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the volume

      • put

        public <T extends CloremObject> void put​(@NonNull
                                         T object)
        Put an object in the database. The object must implement the CloremObject interface.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be saved

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get​(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String key,
                            @NonNull
                            java.lang.String volume)
        Get an object from the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object
        volume - The volume in which the object is stored
        Returns:
        The object

      • update

        public <T extends CloremObject> void update​(@NonNull
                                            T object)
        Update an object in the database. Only use this method when you want to update whole object. If you want to update only a few fields of the object, use the update(String, String, Class, Consumer) method. The object id must be the same as the object id of the object in the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be updated

      • update

        public <T extends CloremObject> void update​(@NonNull
                                            java.lang.String key,
                                            @NonNull
                                            java.lang.String volume,
                                            @NonNull
                                            java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                            @NonNull
                                            java.util.function.Consumer<T> transition)
        Update an object in the database. This method is used to update only required fields of the object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object
        volume - The volume in which the object is stored
        clazz - The class of the object
        transition - The transition function which will be used to update the object

      • delete

        public void delete​(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String key,
                   @NonNull
                   java.lang.String volume)
        Delete an object from the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the object
        volume - The volume in which the object is stored

      • query

        public <T extends CloremObject> java.util.List<T> query​(@NonNull
                                                        java.lang.String volume,
                                                        @NonNull
                                                        java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                        @NonNull
                                                        java.util.function.Predicate<T> condition)
        Query the database. This method returns a list of objects which satisfy the condition.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the objects
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume in which the objects are stored
        clazz - The class of the objects
        condition - The condition which the objects must satisfy. Returns true if the object is to be included in the list.
        Returns:
        A list of objects which satisfy the condition

      • listObjects

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> listObjects​(@NonNull
                                                    java.lang.String volume)
        List all the objects in a volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume in which the objects are stored
        Returns:
        A list of objects
